outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Rob was against them instituting permit parking on Rob's street.
Ruffles walked out.
Rob also spoke at several city council meetings.
Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Rob and his concerns about the city council's actions
- Establish Rob's street as a key setting

II. Inciting Incident
- Rob learns about the city council's plan to institute permit parking on his street
- Rob becomes upset and decides to take action

III. Rising Action
- Rob attends city council meetings to express his opposition to the plan
- Rob's dog Ruffles walks out, symbolizing Rob's frustration and sense of being overwhelmed

IV. Climax
- Rob delivers a passionate speech at a city council meeting, rallying support from the community

V. Resolution
- The city council decides not to implement the permit parking plan, thanks to Rob's efforts

Story:

Rob had always been proud to call his quiet, tree-lined street home. However, lately, he'd been growing increasingly upset about some of the decisions the city council had been making. None of these decisions bothered him more than their plan to institute permit parking on his very own street.

The thought of having to shell out extra money just to park in front of his own house was infuriating to Rob. He knew he wasn't the only one who felt this way, but he was determined to make his voice heard. Rob began attending city council meetings, speaking out against the permit parking plan at every opportunity.

One evening, as Rob was preparing for another council meeting, his dog Ruffles walked out of the house, leaving Rob feeling frustrated and overwhelmed. It was as if Ruffles sensed Rob's anxiety and had decided to take a break from it all. Rob couldn't blame him; the whole situation was exhausting.

Despite his frustration, Rob refused to give up. He continued to attend council meetings, speaking passionately about the negative impact the permit parking plan would have on his community. Slowly but surely, Rob began to rally support from his neighbors and fellow citizens.

Finally, the day of the council's final vote arrived. Rob stood before the council, his voice shaking with determination as he delivered a heartfelt speech about the importance of preserving the character of his street. The room was silent, mesmerized by Rob's words.

When the votes were cast, Rob's efforts were rewarded. The city council decided not to implement the permit parking plan, thanks in large part to Rob's tireless advocacy. As he walked home, Ruffles by his side, Rob felt a sense of pride and vindication. He had stood up for what he believed in, and it had made all the difference.

outline: Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.
Sam thought it was the grossest thing Sam ever saw.
During Holly's senior year Holly was able to apply to graduate schools.
After many weeks, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite.
Sam now eats peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Sam and his brother Barry
- Establish their close relationship

II. Inciting Incident
- Sam sees Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich
- Sam is disgusted by the combination

III. Interlude
- Introduce Holly, a friend or acquaintance of Sam's
- Mention Holly's senior year and graduate school applications

IV. Turning Point
- Sam is persuaded to try a bite of the sandwich after many weeks
- Sam's initial reluctance gives way to curiosity

V. Resolution
- Sam is surprised by his enjoyment of the sandwich
- Sam starts eating peanut butter and banana sandwiches regularly

Story:

Sam and his brother Barry were as close as siblings could get. They shared a love for adventure, sports, and good food. One day, while hanging out in the kitchen, Sam saw Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich. Sam's face contorted in disgust as he thought it was the grossest thing he had ever seen. "How can you eat that, Barry?" Sam asked, scrunching up his nose.

Barry just chuckled and said, "You don't know what you're missing, bro!" Sam shook his head and walked away, convinced that his brother had lost his mind.

Around the same time, Sam's friend Holly was going through a significant milestone - her senior year of college. She was busy applying to graduate schools, and Sam would often help her brainstorm or review her applications. Holly's determination and focus inspired Sam, and he was happy to support her.

Weeks went by, and Barry would occasionally tease Sam about his aversion to the peanut butter and banana sandwich. Sam would jokingly decline, but Barry's persistence eventually wore him down. One day, Barry asked Sam to take just one bite, and after much hesitation, Sam reluctantly agreed.

As soon as the sandwich touched his tongue, Sam's eyes widened in surprise. It wasn't disgusting at all! In fact, the creamy peanut butter and sweet banana complemented each other perfectly. Sam couldn't believe he had judged the sandwich so harshly.

From that day on, Sam became a convert. He started eating peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week, often with Barry, and sometimes even with Holly, who would join them for lunch. Sam learned that sometimes, it takes a little courage to try something new, and you might just discover a new favorite thing.

outline: Cindy loves her coworkers but has never attended happy hour with them.
Cindy is afraid it is unprofessional to drink with coworkers.
Nellie was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand!
Cindy goes to happy hour with her coworkers and Cindy's coworkers all drink beer.
Cindy is very pleased that Cindy joined happy hour with Cindy's coworkers.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Cindy and her coworkers
- Establish Cindy's hesitation to attend happy hour

II. Inciting Incident
- Nellie's unexpected appearance at the office, covered in heavy wet sand
- Cindy's curiosity and concern for Nellie

III. Turning Point
- Cindy's coworkers invite her to happy hour, citing Nellie's story as a reason to unwind
- Cindy's initial refusal due to her fear of being unprofessional

IV. Climax
- Cindy's coworkers reassure her that they value their relationships and want to socialize outside of work
- Cindy decides to join them for happy hour

V. Resolution
- Cindy attends happy hour and finds that her coworkers all drink beer
- Cindy is pleased with her decision and feels more connected to her coworkers

Story:

Cindy loved her coworkers at the marketing firm. They were a lively and supportive group, always willing to lend a hand or offer words of encouragement. Despite their camaraderie, Cindy had never attended happy hour with them. She was afraid that drinking with her coworkers would blur the lines of professionalism and make it difficult to maintain a respectful atmosphere at the office.

One day, Nellie, their usually tidy and composed colleague, walked into the office covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand. Her hair was matted, and her clothes were soaked through. The team was shocked and amused by her appearance, and Nellie explained that she had accidentally fallen into a sandpit while on her lunch break. The incident left everyone in stitches, and Cindy couldn't help but feel a pang of concern for her colleague.

As the day drew to a close, Cindy's coworkers invited her to join them for happy hour, citing Nellie's misadventure as a reason to unwind and have some fun. Cindy initially declined, citing her concerns about being unprofessional. However, her coworkers reassured her that they valued their relationships and wanted to socialize outside of work. They promised that it would be a relaxed and casual gathering, and that they wouldn't let their hair down too much.

Cindy was persuaded, and she decided to join them for happy hour. As they settled into a cozy pub, Cindy was relieved to see that her coworkers all opted for beer, which put her at ease. She ordered a glass of wine and soon found herself laughing and chatting with her colleagues like never before.

As the evening drew to a close, Cindy realized that she had been wrong to hesitate. She was very pleased that she had joined her coworkers for happy hour, and she felt more connected to them than ever before. From that day on, Cindy made it a point to attend happy hour regularly, and she discovered that it was possible to maintain a professional relationship while still having fun with her colleagues.

outline: Larry awakes one night to a sound.
Larry gets up to see if anyone is around.
The only bad thing was that one of Kelly's broke.
Larry see's no one just Larry's family kitten.
Larry heads back to bed and rests easily.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Larry and establish the setting (nighttime, Larry's home)

II. Inciting Incident
- Larry awakes to a sound (Plot Point 1)

III. Rising Action
- Larry gets up to investigate the sound (Plot Point 2)
- He searches the area but finds no one

IV. Complication
- Larry discovers that one of Kelly's (presumably his daughter or family member) belongings is broken (Plot Point 3)

V. Resolution
- Larry sees the family kitten and realizes it was the cause of the sound and the broken item
- He heads back to bed, feeling relieved and at ease (Plot Points 4 and 5)

Story:

Larry was fast asleep in his cozy bed when suddenly, he was jolted awake by a strange sound. He sat up in bed, rubbing his eyes, trying to shake off the grogginess. The sound had come from downstairs, and Larry's curiosity got the better of him. He threw off the covers and got out of bed to see if anyone was around (Plot Point 2).

As he made his way downstairs, the creaking of the stairs beneath his feet seemed to echo through the silent night. He reached the living room and flipped on the light switch, but he saw no one. The room was empty, except for their little family kitten, Whiskers, who was sitting innocently on the couch, watching him with big, round eyes (Plot Point 5).

Larry's gaze fell upon the coffee table, where he noticed that one of Kelly's favorite vases was lying broken on the floor. He let out a sigh, thinking that someone must have accidentally knocked it over. But as he looked around the room again, he realized that the only one who could have done it was Whiskers, who was now busy licking her paw (Plot Point 3).

Feeling a mix of relief and amusement, Larry chuckled to himself. It was just the mischievous kitten who had caused the commotion. He picked up Whiskers and cradled her in his arms, giving her a gentle scolding. "You little troublemaker," he whispered, smiling.

With the mystery solved, Larry headed back to bed, feeling grateful that it was just a minor incident. He snuggled under the covers, Whiskers curled up beside him, and soon drifted off to sleep, resting easily (Plot Point 5).

outline: Ronald was taking intro to Anatomy.
Ronald was grouped with three beautiful women.
Then Marcus suggested Marcus drink more water every day.
Ronald's face turned bright red as soon as the teacher started speaking.
The group giggled but Ronald learned quite a few things.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Ronald, a student taking intro to Anatomy
- Establish the setting: a classroom

II. Inciting Incident
- Ronald is grouped with three beautiful women for a project
- Show Ronald's nervousness around them

III. Rising Action
- Marcus, one of the group members, suggests Ronald drink more water every day
- Ronald's face turns bright red as the teacher starts speaking, embarrassing him in front of the women

IV. Climax
- The group giggles at Ronald's embarrassment, but he tries to focus on the lesson

V. Falling Action
- Despite the initial embarrassment, Ronald learns quite a few things from the lesson

VI. Conclusion
- Ronald reflects on the experience, realizing that he can learn from his mistakes and overcome his nervousness

Story:

Ronald sat nervously in his intro to Anatomy class, fidgeting with his notes as the teacher announced the group project. To his surprise, he was paired with three beautiful women: Sophia, Rachel, and Emily. They introduced themselves with bright smiles, and Ronald's heart skipped a beat. He couldn't help but feel intimidated by their confidence and beauty.

As they began discussing their project, Marcus, one of the women, suggested that Ronald drink more water every day to stay focused. Ronald nodded eagerly, trying to make a good impression. But just as the teacher started speaking, Ronald's face turned bright red. He felt like he was going to pass out from embarrassment.

The group couldn't help but giggle at Ronald's misfortune. Sophia patted him on the back, saying "Don't worry, we've all been there." Rachel and Emily chuckled, but their kind eyes put Ronald at ease. Despite his initial embarrassment, Ronald tried to focus on the lesson, determined to learn something from the experience.

As the class progressed, Ronald found himself absorbing the information like a sponge. He asked questions, participated in discussions, and even managed to make a few witty remarks that earned him nods of approval from his group members. By the end of the class, Ronald realized that he had learned quite a few things, not just about anatomy, but about himself as well.

As he packed up his things, Ronald reflected on the experience. He realized that he didn't have to let his nervousness hold him back. With a newfound sense of confidence, he smiled at his group members and said, "Thanks for putting up with me today. I think I'm going to make it through this class after all." Sophia, Rachel, and Emily smiled back, and Ronald knew that he had found not only study partners, but friends as well.

outline: Laney hated her job.
Laney's boss was rude and mistreated Laney.
Corey researched meditation techniques and found one that worked.
Finally, one day Laney just quit.
Laney was glad Laney stood up for Laney.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Laney and her job
- Show Laney's dissatisfaction with her job

II. Inciting Incident
- Introduce Laney's rude boss
- Show how the boss mistreats Laney

III. Rising Action
- Introduce Corey and his research on meditation techniques
- Show how Corey's discovery helps Laney cope with her job

IV. Climax
- Laney reaches her breaking point and quits her job

V. Falling Action
- Laney reflects on her decision and feels empowered

VI. Resolution
- Laney is glad she stood up for herself

Story:

Laney trudged into the office, her feet heavy with the weight of another monotonous day ahead. She hated her job, and it seemed like the feeling was mutual. Her boss, Mr. Johnson, always found ways to make her life more difficult. He would belittle her in front of her colleagues, and his condescending tone made her skin crawl.

One day, Laney's friend Corey, who had been studying meditation techniques, introduced her to a method that he swore would help her cope with the stress of her job. Laney was skeptical at first, but desperate for a solution, she decided to give it a try. To her surprise, the technique worked wonders. She felt more centered and focused, and her interactions with Mr. Johnson became less infuriating.

However, even with her newfound calm, Laney couldn't shake off the feeling that she was stuck in a toxic work environment. Mr. Johnson continued to be rude and dismissive, and Laney's patience wore thin. Finally, one day, she reached her breaking point. As Mr. Johnson berated her in front of the entire team, Laney stood up, looked him straight in the eye, and quit.

The walk out of the office was the most liberating feeling Laney had experienced in years. She felt a sense of pride and empowerment wash over her as she realized she had stood up for herself. For the first time in a long time, Laney felt like she was taking control of her life. As she looked in the mirror, she smiled, knowing that she was glad she had stood up for Laney.

outline: Jen wanted a new bag.
The one Jen wanted was too expensive.
Ben's team tried hard at the competition, but everyone else was too good.
Jen also took on extra hours.
Jen was happy when Jen was able to buy the bag.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Jen and her desire for a new bag

II. Inciting Incident
- Show the bag Jen wants and its high price

III. Rising Action
- Introduce Ben's team and their struggles in the competition
- Show Jen's determination to buy the bag by taking on extra hours

IV. Climax
- Jen finally earns enough to buy the bag

V. Resolution
- Jen is happy with her new purchase

Story:

Jen had been eyeing a new bag for weeks. It was a sleek, black designer bag with gold hardware, and she couldn't stop thinking about it. However, every time she went to the store, she was discouraged by the hefty price tag. The one Jen wanted was too expensive, and she knew she couldn't afford it on her current salary.

Meanwhile, her friend Ben's team was gearing up for a major competition. They had been training for months, but as the day of the event approached, it became clear that everyone else was too good. Despite their best efforts, Ben's team struggled to keep up, and they ultimately didn't place in the competition.

Jen, determined to buy her dream bag, decided to take on extra hours at work. She picked up shifts on the weekends and even offered to cover her coworkers' breaks. It wasn't easy, but she was driven by her desire for that bag.

Weeks went by, and Jen's hard work paid off. She finally earned enough to buy the bag, and she couldn't wait to get her hands on it. She rushed to the store, her heart racing with excitement, and purchased the bag.

As she walked out of the store, bag in hand, Jen felt an overwhelming sense of happiness. She had worked hard for this, and it was all worth it. She couldn't stop smiling as she admired her new purchase, feeling proud of herself for not giving up.

outline: Ray was looking for a birthday present for his mom.
Ray knew his mom had a new interest in fitness and exercise.
But Joel kept on saving money.
Ray went out and bought the Fitbit.
Ray's mom was really surprised and happy with the Fitbit Ray bought.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Ray and his goal to find a birthday present for his mom

II. Inciting Incident
- Ray learns about his mom's new interest in fitness and exercise

III. Rising Action
- Ray's friend Joel advises him to save money, but Ray decides to spend it on a gift
- Ray goes out and buys a Fitbit, a fitness tracker that aligns with his mom's new interest

IV. Climax
- Ray gives the Fitbit to his mom as a birthday present

V. Falling Action and Resolution
- Ray's mom is surprised and happy with the thoughtful gift

Story:

Ray was determined to find the perfect birthday present for his mom. He wanted it to be something special, something that would show her how much he cared. As he racked his brain for ideas, he remembered that his mom had recently developed a new interest in fitness and exercise. She had been talking about it nonstop, and Ray knew it was something that brought her joy.

Ray's friend Joel, who was known for being frugal, advised him to save his money and not splurge on an expensive gift. "You can get her something cheaper," Joel said. But Ray was resolute. He wanted to get his mom something that would make her feel special, something that would show her he was paying attention to her new hobby.

After some research, Ray decided to buy his mom a Fitbit, a high-tech fitness tracker that would help her monitor her progress and stay motivated. He went out to the store and purchased it, feeling excited and proud of himself for making the decision.

On his mom's birthday, Ray presented her with the Fitbit, carefully wrapped in colorful paper and tied with a bow. His mom's face lit up with surprise and delight as she unwrapped the gift. "Oh, Ray, this is amazing!" she exclaimed. "I've been wanting one of these for weeks!" Ray beamed with pride, happy to see his mom so happy. It was clear that he had made the right decision, and that the Fitbit was the perfect birthday present.

outline: Paul woke up and began to make his coffee.
Paul hadn't realized, but Paul accidently poured in salt instead of sugar.
Mark decided to sell it to someone.
Paul threw the coffee out of the window.
Paul stopped and got another cup of coffee on the way to work.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Paul and his morning routine

II. Inciting Incident
- Paul accidentally pours salt into his coffee instead of sugar

III. Rising Action
- Paul's friend Mark tries to sell the salty coffee to someone
- Paul discovers the mistake and reacts strongly

IV. Climax
- Paul throws the coffee out of the window

V. Resolution
- Paul stops to get another cup of coffee on the way to work

Story:

Paul woke up to the sound of his alarm blaring in his ear. He rubbed the sleep from his eyes and began to make his coffee, a ritual he cherished every morning. As he reached for the sugar, his gaze wandered to the TV, where the news anchor was discussing the latest sports game. In a moment of distraction, Paul hadn't realized he had accidentally poured in salt instead of sugar.

Meanwhile, his friend Mark, who was visiting from out of town, walked into the kitchen and spotted the freshly brewed coffee. Without asking, Mark decided to sell it to someone, thinking he could make a quick buck. He poured the coffee into a to-go cup and headed out the door.

Paul, still unaware of the mistake, took a sip of the coffee and spat it out in disgust. The salty flavor was overwhelming. He rushed to the window and threw the coffee out, watching as it splattered on the sidewalk below.

Feeling frustrated and caffeine-deprived, Paul decided to stop and get another cup of coffee on the way to work. As he waited in line at the coffee shop, he couldn't help but chuckle at the absurdity of the morning's events. He made a mental note to double-check the sugar container in the future. With a fresh cup of coffee in hand, Paul continued on to work, ready to tackle the day ahead.

outline: Kelly got her nails done.
Kelly went to the local salon.
At Bob and Karen's surprise, there were a ton of cars downtown!
The only bad thing was that one of Kelly's broke.
Kelly was so upset.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Kelly
- Establish Kelly's goal: to get her nails done

II. Inciting Incident
- Kelly goes to the local salon to get her nails done (plot point 2)

III. Rising Action
- Kelly gets her nails done (plot point 1)
- Introduce Bob and Karen, who are surprised by the number of cars downtown (plot point 3)

IV. Climax
- One of Kelly's nails breaks (plot point 4)

V. Falling Action
- Kelly becomes upset (plot point 5)

VI. Conclusion
- Kelly deals with the consequences of her broken nail

Story:

Kelly had been looking forward to getting her nails done all week. She finally had a free afternoon, so she headed to the local salon to treat herself. As she walked in, she was greeted by the friendly receptionist and the familiar smell of nail polish.

After a relaxing hour, Kelly's nails were looking fabulous. She was thrilled with the result and couldn't wait to show them off. As she left the salon, she ran into her friends Bob and Karen, who were strolling down the main street.

"What's going on?" Kelly asked, noticing the unusually large crowd.

"We have no idea," Bob replied, "but there are a ton of cars downtown! It's crazy."

Kelly laughed and continued on her way, feeling carefree and glamorous with her new nails. But as she was walking, she accidentally knocked her hand against a lamppost, and one of her freshly painted nails broke.

Kelly was devastated. She had been so careful with her nails, and now one of them was ruined. She felt a lump form in her throat as she gazed at the broken nail. Tears pricked at the corners of her eyes as she thought about how she would have to get it fixed.

Kelly took a deep breath and tried to calm down. She would just have to go back to the salon and get it fixed. It was a minor setback, but it had definitely put a damper on her afternoon.

outline: Emma fell in love with Paul.
Paul didn't feel the same for Emma and rejected Emma.
Colleen is helping calm Dina's fears by being supportive.
Emma felt even worse when the authorities wouldn't listen.
Emma walked under a mattress for a year to show everyone Emma's feelings.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Emma and her feelings for Paul
- Show Emma's confidence in her feelings

II. Inciting Incident
- Paul rejects Emma
- Emma is devastated

III. Rising Action
- Emma tries to report her heartbreak to the authorities
- They dismiss her, making her feel worse
- Introduce Colleen and Dina's subplot to contrast Emma's situation

IV. Climax
- Emma decides to take drastic action to prove her feelings
- She walks under a mattress for a year

V. Conclusion
- Emma's actions have a profound impact on those around her
- Reflection on the consequences of her actions

Story:

Emma had never felt this way about anyone before. She was convinced that Paul was the one, and she couldn't wait to tell him how she felt. With a spring in her step and a song in her heart, she approached him and confessed her love. But Paul's response was not what she had hoped for. He looked at her with a mixture of surprise and discomfort, and told her that he didn't feel the same way.

Emma was crushed. She had never felt so rejected and alone. She tried to shake off the feeling, but it only seemed to intensify as the days went by. In desperation, she turned to the authorities, hoping they could somehow validate her emotions. But they just laughed her off, telling her that heartbreak wasn't a crime. Emma felt like she was going crazy. Why wouldn't anyone take her feelings seriously?

Meanwhile, Colleen was doing her best to calm Dina's fears about an upcoming exam. Dina was a nervous wreck, but Colleen's supportive words and gentle encouragement were slowly but surely helping her to relax. As they sat together in the park, Emma walked by, her eyes fixed on the ground. Colleen noticed her and felt a pang of sympathy, but Emma didn't seem to notice.

In a last-ditch effort to prove the intensity of her emotions, Emma came up with a drastic plan. She would walk under a mattress for a year, a physical manifestation of the weight that was crushing her heart. And so, she set up a makeshift rig in her backyard, and began her strange and solitary journey.

As the months went by, people began to take notice. They would drive by Emma's house and see her walking slowly under the mattress, her face set in a determined expression. Some laughed and pointed, but others were moved to tears by the sight. Colleen and Dina would often stop by, bringing Emma food and water, and listening to her stories of heartache. And as they listened, they began to understand the depth of Emma's pain.

In the end, Emma's actions had a profound impact on those around her. She had shown them that heartbreak was real, and that it deserved to be acknowledged. And as she finally emerged from under the mattress, blinking in the bright sunlight, she knew that she had found a new sense of purpose. She would continue to spread her message, and help others who were struggling to find their voice.

outline: Phil worked his way up from cook to general manager.
When the owner retired, Phil sold the place to Phil.
Kim soon realized that Kim was not in Kim's diary, but on Facebook!
There were times Phil wished Phil was still just an employee.
Phil kept at it and the place was more popular than before.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Phil, a hardworking cook who dreams of becoming the general manager of a restaurant.

II. Phil's Rise to General Manager
- Describe Phil's journey from cook to general manager, highlighting his dedication and perseverance.

III. The Owner's Retirement and the Sale
- The owner of the restaurant retires and sells the business to Phil, making him the new owner.

IV. Kim's Discovery
- Introduce Kim, a new employee who discovers that Phil is on Facebook, not in their diary as they thought.

V. Phil's Challenges as Owner
- Show Phil struggling with the responsibilities of being the owner, wishing he was still just an employee at times.

VI. Phil's Success
- Despite the challenges, Phil perseveres and makes the restaurant more popular than ever before.

Story:

Phil had always been passionate about cooking, and his dedication earned him a spot as a cook in a small restaurant. However, Phil's ambition didn't stop there. He worked tirelessly, taking on extra tasks and learning every aspect of the business. His hard work paid off, and he eventually worked his way up to become the general manager.

Years went by, and the owner of the restaurant decided to retire. Phil, now a seasoned manager, was the perfect candidate to take over. The owner sold the restaurant to Phil, and he became the new owner.

As Phil navigated his new role, he hired a new employee named Kim. Kim was a bit of a introvert and kept to themselves, often writing in their diary during breaks. One day, while scrolling through Facebook, Kim stumbled upon Phil's profile and realized that Phil was not in their diary, as they had thought, but on social media.

As the new owner, Phil faced numerous challenges. There were times when he wished he was still just an employee, without the weight of responsibility on his shoulders. He struggled to balance the books, manage staff, and keep customers happy. However, Phil refused to give up. He poured his heart and soul into the restaurant, making changes and improvements wherever possible.

Despite the initial struggles, Phil's hard work paid off. The restaurant began to flourish under his ownership, and it became more popular than ever before. Customers raved about the new menu, and the staff was happy and motivated. Phil's perseverance had paid off, and he was proud of what he had achieved. He had truly earned his place as the owner of the restaurant, and he knew that he had made the right decision in taking the leap.

outline: Ruth's neighbor was religious.
Ruth's neighbor invited Ruth over for a bible study.
The judge held Maggie's past against her and ruled for her husband.
Ruth and her neighbor read several passages and discussed them.
When Ruth and her neighbor were done, Ruth went home.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Ruth and her neighbor
- Establish the neighbor's religiosity

II. Inciting Incident
- The neighbor invites Ruth over for a bible study

III. Rising Action
- Ruth attends the bible study and they read several passages
- Discussion of the passages takes place

IV. Interlude
- Introduce Maggie's storyline (judge's ruling against her)

V. Falling Action
- Ruth finishes the bible study and heads home

VI. Conclusion
- Ruth reflects on the experience

Story:

Ruth lived next to a kind and gentle soul who was deeply devoted to her faith. Her neighbor's religiosity was evident in the way she carried herself, always with a warm smile and a kind word. One day, the neighbor knocked on Ruth's door and invited her over for a bible study. Ruth, curious and open-minded, accepted the invitation.

The evening of the bible study arrived, and Ruth walked next door to her neighbor's cozy living room. They sat down, surrounded by comfortable cushions and steaming cups of tea, and began to read several passages from the bible. As they read, they discussed the meaning and significance of the words, delving into the context and history behind them. The conversation flowed easily, with Ruth asking thoughtful questions and her neighbor offering insightful answers.

As they took a break, Ruth's neighbor mentioned a friend, Maggie, who was going through a tough time. Maggie was in the midst of a bitter divorce, and the judge had ruled against her, citing her past mistakes as evidence of her unfit nature. Ruth's neighbor shook her head, lamenting the unfairness of the situation.

After their break, Ruth and her neighbor returned to their discussion, exploring more passages and sharing their thoughts. As the evening drew to a close, Ruth thanked her neighbor for the enlightening experience and headed back home. As she settled into her own cozy routine, Ruth couldn't help but reflect on the bible study and the kindness of her neighbor. She felt grateful for the opportunity to connect with someone on a deeper level, and she looked forward to their next gathering.

outline: Stan styled his hair like a popular singer.
Stan loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance.
Cindy goes to happy hour with her coworkers and Cindy's coworkers all drink beer.
Stan looked at himself in the mirror.
Then Stan got out a razor and shaved off Stan's hair.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction to Stan and his hairstyle
- Introduce Stan, a young man who styles his hair like a popular singer
- Show Stan's confidence and love for the attention he receives from girls due to his hairstyle

II. Cindy's happy hour with coworkers
- Introduce Cindy and her coworkers at a happy hour event
- Describe the atmosphere and the fact that Cindy's coworkers all drink beer

III. Stan's moment of self-reflection
- Show Stan looking at himself in the mirror, perhaps feeling a sense of vanity or self-doubt
- Introduce a turning point where Stan begins to question his motivations for styling his hair like the singer

IV. The transformation
- Stan gets out a razor and shaves off his hair, symbolizing a change in his perspective or identity
- Describe Stan's emotions and thoughts during and after the transformation

Tom was a rookie hiker who decided to hike by himself, despite his friends' warnings. He had done this particular trail many times before, and he was confident in his ability to navigate it. As he walked, he felt a sense of freedom and exhilaration, enjoying the sights and sounds of nature.

But as the sun began to set, Tom realized he had stayed out later than he intended. The trail, which had been so familiar in the daylight, now looked completely different in the dark. He had no flashlight, and his phone was dead. Panic began to set in as he realized he was lost.

As he wandered through the woods, he stumbled upon a campsite. An older woman, Edna, was sitting by the fire, and her young son was playing with a toy car. Tom approached them, hoping for help. Edna's son looked up at him with wide eyes, clutching the toy car tightly. Edna told him that he could keep the toy if he wanted, and the boy's face lit up with joy.

Tom explained his situation to Edna, and she listened sympathetically. She told him that she and her son were camping for the night, but she could help him find his way home. Tom gratefully accepted her offer. Edna taught him how to navigate using the north star, pointing out the constellations in the night sky.

With newfound confidence, Tom set off into the darkness, following the north star. The night air was cool and crisp, and he felt a sense of wonder at the vastness of the universe. As he walked, the stars guided him home, and eventually, he saw the lights of his town in the distance. He made his way back to his car, exhausted but relieved. From now on, he vowed to always be better prepared, but he was grateful for the unexpected adventure and the kindness of strangers.

Emma sat on the living room floor, surrounded by toys and blocks, as her curious toddler, Jack, explored the room. The book's worn leather cover and yellowed pages held stories of their ancestors, and Emma cherished it dearly.

As Emma momentarily turned her attention to preparing a snack, Jack's eyes landed on the book. Without hesitation, he grasped a nearby marker and swiped it across the open page. Emma, engrossed in her task, didn't notice the mischief until it was too late. By the time she remembered to check on Jack, the damage was done.

Emma's heart sank as she rushed to the book's side. The vibrant marker strokes marred the delicate pages, and she worried that her carelessness had ruined the family treasure forever. She gently turned the pages, hoping against hope that the damage wasn't as bad as it seemed. But with each turn, her anxiety grew. The thought of her grandmother's book being permanently disfigured was unbearable.

Just as Emma was about to give in to despair, she remembered a trick her mother had once shared about removing marker stains. With a mix of hope and trepidation, Emma dampened a cloth and gently began to wipe the affected pages. To her relief, the marker ink began to lift, slowly but surely, until the pages were once again pristine.

Emma breathed a sigh of relief as she closed the book, grateful that her quick thinking had saved the family heirloom. She couldn't help but smile at Jack, who was now busy building a tower with blocks, oblivious to the chaos he had caused. Emma realized that, despite the close call, the experience had taught her a valuable lesson: to cherish not only the book but also the memories she made with her little one.

Jenna was on her way home from a trip, and all she could think about was getting back to her boyfriend, Alex. She had missed him terribly and couldn't wait to see him again. However, she wasn't alone on her journey. Her sister Linah, who was eight months pregnant, was accompanying her.

As they drove, Linah's excitement about the upcoming arrival of her baby was palpable. She had always dreamed of being a stay-at-home mother, and Jenna knew that her sister was counting down the days until she could devote herself full-time to her child.

As they approached the city, Linah suddenly suggested a detour to the local museum. Jenna was hesitant, knowing that it would add hours to their journey, but Linah was insistent. She had always been fascinated by history, and the museum was featuring a new exhibit on ancient civilizations.

Jenna reluctantly agreed, and they parked their car outside the museum. As they walked through the galleries, Linah was in her element, marveling at the artifacts and reading every placard with rapt attention. Jenna, on the other hand, was growing increasingly impatient. She had been looking forward to seeing Alex all day, and now it seemed like they would be lucky to make it home before dinner.

As Linah lingered in front of a display case, Jenna couldn't help but tap her foot in frustration. "Can we please hurry up, Linah?" she asked, trying to keep her tone light. "I really want to get home to Alex."

Linah looked up, apologetic. "I'm sorry, Jenna. I just want to make the most of our day out. We can leave soon, I promise."

Finally, after what felt like an eternity to Jenna, Linah was satisfied that she had seen everything. They made their way back to the car, and Jenna breathed a sigh of relief as they got back on the road. As they drove, Linah chatted excitedly about the exhibits they had seen, and Jenna smiled, happy to see her sister so happy.

As the sun began to set, they finally pulled into Jenna's driveway. She was home at last, and Alex was waiting on the porch, a smile on his face. - Introduce protagonist, Bobby, at a fast food restaurant

- Bobby pours ketchup from the dispenser

III. Turning Point
- Betty intervenes with a better idea

IV. Confrontation
- Bobby throws away the ketchup

V. Resolution
- Bobby asks for ketchup packets at the counter

Story:

Bobby walked into the bustling fast food restaurant, his stomach growling with hunger. He made his way to the condiment counter, where he poured a generous amount of ketchup from the dispenser onto his fries. Just as he was about to take a bite, his friend Betty, who was sitting across from him, spoke up.

"Hey, Bobby, why don't we ask for ketchup packets instead?" she suggested. "That way, we can control how much ketchup we use and avoid making a mess."

Bobby thought for a moment, then nodded in agreement. He scooped up the ketchup he had just poured and threw it away in the trash can. Feeling a bit more environmentally conscious, he got up from his seat and walked over to the counter.

"Excuse me," he said to the cashier, "can I get some ketchup packets, please?"

The cashier smiled and handed him a few packets. Bobby returned to his seat, feeling satisfied with his decision. He ripped open a packet and squeezed a small amount onto his fries, enjoying his meal with a clear conscience, thanks to Betty's better idea.

outline: Tom was at the mall.
Tom went into a store and the alarm went off.
After some time, Mary's brother felt a pang of guilt.
On the way out an employee asked Tom some questions.
It was clear Tom hadn't stolen and Tom went on Tom's way.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Tom at the mall

II. Inciting Incident
- Tom enters a store, triggering the alarm

III. Rising Action
- Introduce Mary's brother, who feels guilty about something (implying he might be responsible for the alarm)

IV. Climax
- Tom is questioned by an employee on his way out of the store

V. Resolution
- Tom is cleared of any wrongdoing and continues on his way

Story:

Tom strolled through the bustling corridors of the mall, window-shopping and enjoying the lively atmosphere. As he turned a corner, he spotted a store that caught his eye - a trendy clothing boutique. He pushed open the door and stepped inside, immediately triggering the security alarm. The loud beeping and flashing lights startled him, and he froze, unsure of what to do.

Meanwhile, in a nearby food court, Mary's brother, Alex, sat sipping a coffee, his mind elsewhere. He had been struggling with his conscience all morning, feeling a growing sense of guilt about something he had done. As he heard the commotion from the boutique, his heart skipped a beat. He wondered if his actions might be connected to the alarm.

Back in the store, Tom waited patiently as the employees rushed to investigate. After a few minutes, they determined that the alarm had been triggered by a faulty sensor, and Tom was free to go. As he made his way to the exit, an employee stopped him to ask a few questions. "Sir, can you tell me what you were doing in the store? Did you touch anything or try to take anything?"

Tom explained that he had simply walked in and the alarm went off, and the employee nodded sympathetically. It was clear that Tom hadn't stolen anything, and the employee apologized for the inconvenience. With a wave, Tom continued on his way, leaving the store and the drama behind him. Alex, still sitting in the food court, breathed a sigh of relief, grateful that his guilt was unfounded.

outline: Linah worked at Starbucks.
Linah was expecting Linah's first child.
John and Sue decided on a restaurant.
Once the baby was born Linah wanted to be a stay at home mother.
Linah quit her job and Linah's husband picked up another job.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Linah, a barista at Starbucks, and her pregnancy

II. Inciting Incident
- John and Sue decide on a restaurant, which will later affect Linah's life

III. Rising Action
- Linah's pregnancy progresses, and she starts to think about her future as a mother

IV. Climax
- Linah gives birth and decides to become a stay-at-home mother

V. Falling Action
- Linah quits her job at Starbucks, and her husband picks up another job to support the family

VI. Resolution
- The new family adjusts to their new life, with Linah as a full-time mother and her husband working multiple jobs

Story:

Linah was a bright and cheerful barista at the local Starbucks, always ready with a smile and a perfect latte. But behind the counter, Linah was hiding a secret: she was expecting her first child. As her belly grew, so did her excitement and anticipation for motherhood.

Meanwhile, John and Sue, Linah's friends, were making plans to open their own restaurant in the neighborhood. They would often meet at Starbucks to discuss their venture, and Linah would listen in, intrigued by their entrepreneurial spirit.

As Linah's pregnancy progressed, she began to think about her future as a mother. She knew she wanted to be a stay-at-home mom, to be there for every milestone and moment of her child's life. But that would mean giving up her job at Starbucks, which was a daunting thought.

Finally, the day arrived, and Linah gave birth to a beautiful baby boy. As she held him in her arms, she knew she had made the right decision. She couldn't imagine leaving him in daycare and going back to work.

With a heavy heart, Linah quit her job at Starbucks, saying goodbye to her colleagues and regular customers. Her husband, who had been supportive throughout her pregnancy, stepped up to take on another job to support their growing family.

It wasn't easy, but Linah and her husband adjusted to their new life. Linah was a full-time mother, dedicating herself to caring for their baby boy. Her husband worked tirelessly, juggling two jobs to provide for their family. And John and Sue's restaurant became a regular spot for the new family, a place where they could relax and enjoy a meal together.

As Linah looked around at her new life, she knew it was all worth it. She had made the right decision, and she was exactly where she was meant to be.

outline: Bob and Karen weren't sure what to do on a Fall Friday evening.
Since the big game was the next day, Bob and Karen wanted an early night.
Sarah named Sarah's fish Cat.
At Bob and Karen's surprise, there were a ton of cars downtown!
There wound up being a huge event downtown for Bob and Karen to do!
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Bob and Karen, a couple looking for something to do on a Fall Friday evening
- Establish their desire for an early night due to the big game the next day

II. Inciting Incident
- Introduce Sarah and her fish, Cat, as a way to add a new element to the story
- Show Bob and Karen's surprise at the number of cars downtown

III. Rising Action
- Reveal the huge event downtown that Bob and Karen stumble upon
- Describe their excitement and decision to attend the event

IV. Climax
- Bob and Karen enjoy the event, forgetting about their initial plans for an early night

V. Resolution
- Conclude the story with Bob and Karen having a great time, despite their initial uncertainty

Story:

It was a crisp Fall Friday evening, and Bob and Karen were struggling to come up with something to do. They had considered watching a movie, playing board games, or even going for a walk, but nothing seemed to spark their interest. The big game was the next day, and they both wanted to get a good night's sleep, so they didn't want to do anything too exciting.

As they were brainstorming, their friend Sarah stopped by to show off her new pet fish, Cat. Bob and Karen oohed and ahhed over the tiny creature, momentarily distracted from their evening plans.

On a whim, Bob suggested they take a drive downtown to see if anything was happening. Karen agreed, and they set off into the evening. As they turned onto Main Street, they were shocked to see a ton of cars parked along the sidewalk. "What's going on?" Karen wondered aloud.

Bob pulled over to ask a pedestrian, who told them that the city was hosting a huge Fall Festival downtown. There would be live music, food vendors, and even a bonfire. Bob and Karen exchanged a thrilled glance. This was exactly the kind of excitement they needed to kick off the weekend.

They parked the car and joined the crowd, forgetting all about their initial plans for an early night. As they wandered through the festival, they sampled local delicacies, danced to the music, and even won a few prizes at the ring toss. The night was turning out to be much more fun than they had anticipated.

As the evening drew to a close, Bob and Karen reluctantly made their way back to the car, exhausted but exhilarated. "Best. Friday. Ever," Karen declared, snuggling into her seat. Bob grinned, already looking forward to the big game the next day. Despite their initial uncertainty, they had stumbled upon an unforgettable night, all thanks to Sarah's fish, Cat, and a chance drive downtown.

outline: Katie's mom had twins when Katie was four.
At first Katie hated the twins!
Jeremy threw the jars away in the trash.
Katie felt abandoned.
But soon enough, Katie grew to love her baby sisters!
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Katie, a 4-year-old girl
- Establish Katie's life before the twins' arrival

II. Inciting Incident
- Katie's mom gives birth to twins
- Katie's initial reaction to the twins

III. Rising Action
- Katie struggles to adjust to the new additions
- Jeremy's actions exacerbate Katie's feelings

IV. Climax
- Katie feels abandoned and overwhelmed

V. Falling Action
- Katie begins to bond with her baby sisters

VI. Resolution
- Katie grows to love her baby sisters

Story:

Katie was a happy and carefree 4-year-old who had her mom's undivided attention. She loved playing with her dolls and going on adventures with her mom. But everything changed when her mom brought home two tiny bundles of joy - twin baby sisters.

At first, Katie hated the twins. She felt like they were stealing her mom's attention and disrupting her peaceful life. She would often sulk and refuse to play with them, hoping they would just disappear. Her mom tried to reassure her that she loved her just the same, but Katie wasn't convinced.

One day, while her mom was busy feeding the twins, Jeremy, the neighbor's boy, came over to play. Katie was excited to have some company, but things took a turn for the worse when Jeremy started playing with the twins' baby food jars. He carelessly threw them away in the trash, making a mess and causing Katie's mom to scold him. Katie felt frustrated and angry, thinking that Jeremy was making things worse.

As the days went by, Katie started to feel abandoned. Her mom was always busy with the twins, and she felt like she was no longer important. She would often cry herself to sleep at night, feeling like she was losing her mom's love.

But one day, something changed. Katie's mom asked her to help with feeding the twins, and as she held one of the tiny babies in her arms, she felt a surge of love and responsibility. She started to help with their care, and soon enough, she grew to love her baby sisters. She would play with them, sing to them, and even help with their bath time.

As Katie looked at her baby sisters, she realized that they weren't so bad after all. In fact, they brought a new kind of joy and love into her life. She was grateful to have them as her sisters, and she knew that her mom loved her just the same. Katie learned that sometimes, change can be scary, but it can also bring new and wonderful things into our lives.

outline: Graham put his new product idea on a crowdfunding site.
Graham raised five thousand dollars for Graham's product idea.
The basement was totally flooded from a leak!
Graham got sued for product infringement.
Graham lost all of Graham's money in the lawsuit.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Graham and his new product idea
- Graham puts his product idea on a crowdfunding site

II. Rising Action
- Graham raises $5,000 for his product idea
- Graham starts working on his product, using the basement as a workspace

III. Complication
- A leak causes the basement to flood, damaging Graham's equipment and materials
- Graham's product development is delayed

IV. Crisis
- Graham gets sued for product infringement
- Graham's lawsuit is costly and time-consuming

V. Resolution
- Graham loses all his money in the lawsuit
- Graham is left with nothing, including his product idea

Story:

Graham was thrilled to finally put his new product idea on a crowdfunding site. He had spent months perfecting the design and was confident that it would be a hit. And he was right - within weeks, he had raised an impressive $5,000 from enthusiastic backers.

With the funds in hand, Graham set up a makeshift workshop in his basement and got to work. He spent long hours assembling prototypes, testing materials, and refining his design. Things were going smoothly, and he was on track to deliver his product to his backers on time.

But disaster struck one fateful night when Graham woke up to the sound of gushing water. He rushed downstairs to find his basement totally flooded from a leak in the pipes. His equipment, materials, and prototypes were all ruined, and his workspace was destroyed.

The setback was significant, but Graham was determined to push on. He spent the next few weeks cleaning up the mess and rebuilding his workshop. However, just as he was getting back on track, he received a devastating letter in the mail. A large corporation was suing him for product infringement, claiming that his design was too similar to one of their own products.

The lawsuit was a nightmare. Graham spent all his time and money fighting the case, but in the end, the court ruled against him. He was ordered to pay a hefty sum in damages, and he lost all the money he had raised on the crowdfunding site. His product idea, once so full of promise, was now nothing more than a distant memory. Graham was left with nothing, his dreams of entrepreneurship shattered by the cruel twist of fate.

outline: Bryan is in the third grade.
Bryan does not listen to his parents.
Bill sold Bill's stocks and made millions!
Bryan now has to go to a tutor every night.
Bryan has now learned how to do Bryan's math.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Bryan, a third-grader who doesn't listen to his parents
- Show Bryan's struggles in math class

II. Inciting Incident
- Bryan's parents discover his poor math grades
- They decide to use the money from Bill's successful stock sale to hire a tutor for Bryan

III. Rising Action
- Bryan starts attending tutoring sessions every night
- He is initially resistant to learning, but the tutor's patience and encouragement begin to pay off

IV. Climax
- Bryan finally understands a difficult math concept and becomes motivated to learn more

V. Resolution
- Bryan's hard work and newfound understanding of math lead to improved grades and a sense of accomplishment

Story:

Bryan was a rambunctious third-grader who never listened to his parents. He would often ignore their warnings and do things his own way, which often landed him in trouble. One subject where Bryan struggled the most was math. He would stare blankly at his textbook, unable to make sense of the numbers and symbols.

One day, Bryan's parents received his report card, and they were shocked to see his poor grades in math. They knew they had to take action, and fortunately, they had the means to do so. Bryan's uncle Bill had recently sold his stocks and made millions, and he had generously offered to help his family in any way he could. Bryan's parents decided to use some of that money to hire a tutor for Bryan.

At first, Bryan was resistant to the idea of tutoring. He didn't want to spend his evenings stuck inside with a teacher, but his parents were firm. Every night, Bryan would trudge to the tutor's house, his backpack full of math books and worksheets. The tutor, Mrs. Johnson, was patient and kind, but Bryan was determined to make her job difficult. He would fidget and daydream, refusing to focus on the lesson at hand.

But Mrs. Johnson didn't give up. She saw something in Bryan that he didn't even see in himself – potential. She encouraged him, praised his small victories, and slowly but surely, Bryan began to come around. One evening, as they were working on a particularly tricky problem, something clicked. Bryan's eyes lit up, and he exclaimed, "I get it!" Mrs. Johnson beamed with pride, and from that moment on, Bryan was hooked.

With renewed enthusiasm, Bryan attacked his math homework every night. He practiced and practiced, and soon, his grades began to rise. His parents were overjoyed, and Bryan felt a sense of accomplishment he had never felt before. He realized that listening to his parents and putting in the effort had paid off, and he was grateful for the opportunity to learn and grow. As he sat at his desk, math book open in front of him, Bryan smiled, knowing that he had finally learned how to do his math.

outline: Chris had been agoraphobic for years.
Chris had a special worker from the state come and bring Chris things.
Lori ran right into the garage door.
When Chris tried it Chris was amazed at how bright it was outside.
Chris promised his worker he would try it more.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Chris, an agoraphobic individual who has been confined to their home for years
- Mention the special worker from the state who brings Chris necessities

II. Inciting Incident
- Introduce Lori, who accidentally runs into the garage door, causing a commotion

III. Turning Point
- Chris, curious about the noise, decides to venture out of their comfort zone and try going outside

IV. Climax
- Chris is amazed by the brightness of the outside world, a sensory experience they had forgotten

V. Resolution
- Chris promises their worker to continue trying to overcome their agoraphobia

Story:

Chris had been agoraphobic for years, unable to muster the courage to step foot outside their home. The world outside seemed like a daunting, overwhelming place, and Chris felt safer within the confines of their four walls. To make life easier, a special worker from the state, named Sarah, would visit Chris regularly, bringing groceries, medication, and other essential items.

One day, as Sarah was making her usual delivery, a loud crash echoed from the garage. Lori, Chris's neighbor, had accidentally run right into the garage door while rushing to get her mail. The commotion was enough to rouse Chris from their usual routine.

Curiosity got the better of Chris, and they decided to take a peek outside to see what all the fuss was about. With trepidation, Chris slowly made their way to the door, their heart racing with anticipation. As they opened the door, a warm, golden light spilled in, and Chris was taken aback. When Chris tried going outside, they were amazed at how bright it was. The sun's rays danced across their skin, and the fresh air filled their lungs. It was a sensory experience Chris had forgotten, and it was almost overwhelming.

Sarah, who had been watching from the sidelines, beamed with pride at Chris's small but significant step. "You did it, Chris!" she exclaimed. Chris, still basking in the wonder of the outside world, promised Sarah that they would try it more, that they would continue to push past their fears and reclaim their life. With a newfound sense of determination, Chris took another step forward, and Sarah was there to support them every step of the way.

outline: Mary needed to find a dress to wear to her high school prom.
Mary went to many stores and couldn't find a dress Mary liked.
The owner told David the secret to success is online marketing.
On prom night, everyone commented on how lovely Mary's dress looked.
Mary felt happy that Mary had such a nice dress.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Mary, a high school student, and her need to find a dress for prom

II. Inciting Incident
- Mary searches for a dress in many stores but can't find one she likes

III. Turning Point
- Mary's friend David, who has an online business, shares the secret to his success: online marketing
- Mary decides to try online shopping

IV. Climax
- Mary finds the perfect dress online and buys it

V. Resolution
- On prom night, Mary wears the dress and receives compliments from everyone
- Mary feels happy and confident in her dress

Story:

Mary was excited for her high school prom, but she had one major problem: she didn't have a dress to wear. She had been searching for weeks, visiting every store in town, but nothing seemed quite right. Either the dresses were too expensive, too flashy, or just plain ugly. Mary was starting to lose hope.

One day, while chatting with her friend David, Mary mentioned her dress dilemma. David, who had started his own online business, listened sympathetically. "You know, Mary, the secret to my success is online marketing," he said. "You should try shopping online. You can find anything you want with just a few clicks."

Mary took David's advice to heart. She spent the next few hours browsing online dress stores, and finally, she found it: the perfect dress. It was a beautiful, flowing gown in her favorite color, and it was on sale. Mary couldn't believe her luck. She ordered the dress and waited anxiously for it to arrive.

On prom night, Mary put on her new dress and felt like a princess. When she arrived at the dance, everyone commented on how lovely she looked. "Wow, Mary, that dress is stunning!" her friends exclaimed. Mary beamed with pride, feeling happy and confident in her beautiful dress. She was grateful to David for his advice and thrilled that she had found the perfect dress online.

outline: Neil was ending his visit to Germany.
Neil decided his last sight would be the Black Forest.
Graham got sued for product infringement.
Neil thought of the German fairy tales set here.
Neil thought the forest was spooky, but beautiful nonetheless!
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Neil, who is ending his visit to Germany
- Establish Neil's desire to see the Black Forest before leaving

II. The Black Forest
- Describe Neil's experience in the Black Forest
- Incorporate Neil's thoughts about German fairy tales set in the forest
- Show Neil's mixed emotions about the forest's atmosphere

III. The Unexpected News
- Introduce Graham, who is not physically present in the Black Forest
- Reveal that Graham got sued for product infringement
- Show Neil's reaction to the news

IV. Conclusion
- Wrap up Neil's visit to the Black Forest
- Reflect on Neil's thoughts and feelings about the experience

Story:

As Neil packed his bags to leave Germany, he couldn't help but feel a pang of sadness. He had fallen in love with the country's rich history, vibrant culture, and breathtaking landscapes. But before departing, he wanted to see one last sight – the enchanting Black Forest.

As he wandered through the forest's towering trees, Neil's mind began to wander to the German fairy tales he had read as a child. He imagined Hansel and Gretel getting lost in the very woods he was walking through, and the Brothers Grimm's dark stories coming to life around him. The atmosphere was indeed spooky, with the trees casting long, ominous shadows in the fading light. Yet, despite the initial unease, Neil couldn't deny the forest's beauty. The rustling of leaves, the chirping of birds, and the soft filtering of sunlight through the canopy above all combined to create an otherworldly charm.

Just as Neil was getting lost in the forest's mystique, his phone buzzed in his pocket. He pulled it out to find a message from his friend Graham, who was back in the States. Graham's news was unexpected and jarring – he had just been sued for product infringement. Neil's mind reeled as he tried to process the information. He had always thought of Graham as a meticulous and responsible business owner; the news came as a shock.

Despite the distraction, Neil couldn't help but feel grateful for this last experience in Germany. The Black Forest, with all its eerie beauty, had left an indelible mark on his heart. As he made his way back to his car, Neil knew that this was a memory he would cherish for a long time to come. With a final glance at the forest, he bid farewell to Germany, already planning his next visit.

outline: Dawn and Joyce went for a walk.
It wasn't long till it started raining hard.
Jen also took on extra hours.
Dawn and Joyce got so cold and wet.
Dawn and Joyce had to change their clothes.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce the main characters, Dawn and Joyce
- Establish the setting: a walk on a day that will eventually turn rainy

II. Inciting Incident
- Dawn and Joyce go for a walk (Plot Point 1)
- Describe their initial enjoyment of the walk

III. Rising Action
- The rain starts pouring down (Plot Point 2)
- Dawn and Joyce get cold and wet (Plot Point 4)

IV. Subplot
- Introduce Jen, a secondary character
- Mention that Jen took on extra hours (Plot Point 3)
- Show how Jen's action affects Dawn and Joyce's situation

V. Climax
- Dawn and Joyce realize they need to change their clothes (Plot Point 5)

VI. Resolution
- Dawn and Joyce find a solution to their predicament
- Conclude the story with a sense of relief and closure

Story:

Dawn and Joyce laced up their walking shoes and set out on a crisp morning, eager to get some exercise and fresh air. The sun was shining, and a gentle breeze rustled the leaves of the trees as they strolled through the park. They chatted and laughed, enjoying each other's company as they walked.

But it wasn't long till the sky darkened, and the wind picked up. Before they knew it, the rain started pouring down, soaking them to the bone. Dawn and Joyce quickened their pace, trying to find shelter, but it was too late. They were drenched, their clothes clinging to their shivering bodies.

Meanwhile, Jen, a friend who worked at a nearby café, had taken on extra hours to cover a colleague's shift. As the rain poured down, the café became a haven for people seeking refuge from the storm. Jen was busy serving hot drinks and warm pastries to the soaked customers, including Dawn and Joyce, who stumbled in, shivering and bedraggled.

As they waited in line, Dawn and Joyce couldn't help but notice how cold and wet they were. They exchanged a miserable glance, knowing they had to change their clothes as soon as possible. Jen, noticing their distress, offered them a warm towel and a hot chocolate, which they gratefully accepted.

Finally, after what seemed like an eternity, they reached the front of the line and ordered a hot drink. As they sipped their coffee, they made plans to head back to Dawn's place, where they could change into dry clothes and warm up. With a sense of relief, they left the café, ready to face the rest of the day, dry and comfortable once again.

outline: Tim got a new cat.
The cat always ran from Tim.
John was just glad John got all the way through it.
The cat was curious.
Then Tim and Tim's cat played with the yarn together.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Tim and his new cat
- Establish the cat's behavior of running from Tim

II. Inciting Incident
- Tim tries to interact with the cat, but it runs away
- John, a friend or family member, observes the situation and is relieved that Tim is going through this experience

III. Rising Action
- The cat's curiosity gets the better of it, and it starts to sneak peeks at Tim
- Tim notices the cat's curiosity and sees an opportunity to bond with it

IV. Climax
- Tim uses yarn to entice the cat to play, and it works
- The cat and Tim start playing together, marking a turning point in their relationship

V. Resolution
- Tim and the cat continue to play and bond, with the cat no longer running away from Tim

Story:

Tim was thrilled to bring home his new cat, a beautiful grey and white furball he named Whiskers. However, his excitement was short-lived, as Whiskers seemed to have a peculiar habit - it always ran from Tim. Whether he tried to pet it, feed it, or simply talk to it, Whiskers would dart away, leaving Tim feeling frustrated and confused.

John, Tim's friend, watched the scene unfold with a mix of amusement and empathy. "I'm just glad you got all the way through it, Tim," he said, shaking his head. "I don't know how you're going to win that cat over."

But Tim was determined. He observed Whiskers from a distance, noticing that despite its fear, the cat was curious. It would sneak peeks at Tim when it thought he wasn't looking, and its ears would perk up at the slightest sound. Tim saw an opportunity and decided to take a chance.

He pulled out a ball of yarn and began to tease Whiskers with it, dangling it just out of reach. At first, the cat was hesitant, but its curiosity eventually got the better of it. It crept closer, its eyes fixed on the yarn, and Tim held his breath. Then, in a flash of fur and color, Whiskers pounced, batting at the yarn with its paw.

Tim laughed with joy, and Whiskers, sensing his happiness, began to play along. Together, they chased the yarn around the room, lapping the furniture and having the time of their lives. For the first time, Whiskers wasn't running from Tim - it was running with him.

From that day on, Tim and Whiskers were inseparable. They played with the yarn every day, and their bond grew stronger with each passing moment. John would often visit and watch them play, shaking his head in amazement at the transformation. "I guess sometimes all it takes is a little yarn to bring people together," he'd say, smiling.

outline: Annie remembered standing at this same quilt show last year.
This time around, Annie had a quilt on display.
When Daniel fills the feeders, the birds alert their friends by chirping.
The judging had just finished.
Annie had earned an honorable mention ribbon.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce Annie and her connection to the quilt show
- Establish the setting: the quilt show

II. Development
- Describe Annie's quilt on display
- Introduce Daniel and his bird-feeding habit
- Show the judging process

III. Climax
- The judging finishes
- Annie's quilt is evaluated

IV. Resolution
- Annie receives an honorable mention ribbon
- Reflect on Annie's growth and accomplishment

V. Conclusion
- Tie back to the beginning: Annie's memory of last year's quilt show

Story:

Annie stood amidst the vibrant colors and intricate patterns of the quilt show, a sense of nostalgia washing over her. She remembered standing at this same show last year, admiring the beautiful creations on display. But this time around, Annie had a quilt on display, her own masterpiece titled "Morning Song."

As she gazed at her quilt, she thought of Daniel, her neighbor who had inspired the design. When Daniel filled the feeders in his backyard, the birds would alert their friends by chirping, creating a symphony of sounds that Annie loved. She had captured the essence of that moment in her quilt, with birds perched on branches and leaves rustling in the breeze.

The judges had been making their way around the exhibit, carefully examining each quilt. Annie had watched anxiously as they stopped in front of hers, taking notes and whispering to each other. The judging had just finished, and now all that was left was the wait.

Finally, the emcee took the stage, a microphone in hand. "And the winners of this year's quilt show are..." Annie's heart skipped a beat as the names were announced, her quilt not among the top three. But then, the emcee continued, "And earning an honorable mention ribbon, Annie for her beautiful 'Morning Song' quilt!"

Annie's face lit up with a smile as she made her way to the stage to collect her ribbon. She felt a sense of pride and accomplishment, knowing that her hard work had paid off. As she looked out at the crowd, she remembered standing at this same show last year, never imagining that she would be a participant this time around. Now, with her ribbon in hand, Annie felt like she was exactly where she was meant to be.

outline: Tina had a paper due in two hours.
Only problem was Tina did not start it yet.
On the way out an employee asked Tom some questions.
To Tina's delight Tina got a great grade in the end.
Tina could not believe it.
responses:
Plan:

I. Introduction
- Introduce protagonist Tina and her situation (paper due in 2 hours, hasn't started yet)

II. Inciting Incident
- Tina meets Tom, who is an expert in the subject, at a coffee shop
- Tom is approached by an employee with questions, distracting Tina

III. Rising Action
- Tina takes advantage of the distraction to ask Tom for help with her paper
- Tom agrees to assist Tina, and they work together to complete the paper

IV. Climax
- Tina submits the paper just in time, feeling anxious about the outcome

V. Falling Action
- Tina receives her grade and is thrilled to find out she got a great score

VI. Resolution
- Tina is in disbelief, but relieved and grateful for Tom's help

Story:

Tina sat at her desk, staring blankly at her computer screen. She had a paper due in two hours, but the only problem was she hadn't started it yet. Panic began to set in as she thought about the consequences of not submitting it on time. In desperation, she decided to take a break and grab a coffee from the shop down the street.

As she waited in line, she noticed a man sitting at a table, typing away on his laptop. He looked like he knew what he was doing, and Tina couldn't help but wonder if he was an expert in her subject. Just then, an employee approached him and asked some questions, momentarily distracting him. Tina saw her chance and introduced herself, explaining her situation and asking for his help.

The man, Tom, was kind and willing to assist Tina. Together, they worked feverishly to complete the paper, with Tom providing valuable insights and guidance. As the deadline loomed closer, Tina submitted the paper, feeling a mix of anxiety and relief.

The wait for the grade was agonizing, but finally, the results were in. To Tina's delight, she got a great grade in the end. She couldn't believe it, staring at the screen in disbelief. She was relieved, grateful, and thrilled that all her hard work (and Tom's help) had paid off. She made a mental note to thank Tom again and treat him to a coffee, feeling grateful for the chance encounter that had saved her from disaster.

outline: Jamie works almost 7 days a week at his job.
The only thing Jamie has ever wanted was a Jeep Wrangler.
Adam checked Adam's phone.
Jamie's wife stood beside a brand new Jeep with a giant bow on it!
Jamie was so excited, Jamie couldn't wait to go for a ride with Jamie's wife.
responses:
Plan:

II. Establish Jamie's dream: Show Jamie's longing for a Jeep Wrangler, highlighting its significance to him.

III. The surprise setup: Introduce Adam, who checks Jamie's phone, setting the stage for the surprise.

IV. The big reveal: Jamie's wife surprises him with a brand new Jeep Wrangler, complete with a giant bow.

V. Conclusion: Jamie's excitement and eagerness to take the Jeep for a ride with his wife.

Story:

Jamie had been working non-stop, almost 7 days a week, for what felt like an eternity. His job was demanding, but he was determined to provide for his family. Despite the exhaustion, Jamie's mind often wandered to his lifelong dream: owning a Jeep Wrangler. He had always been fascinated by its rugged design and the freedom it represented. For years, he had been saving up, but it seemed like an unattainable goal.

One day, while Jamie was busy at work, his friend Adam stopped by to visit. As they chatted, Adam casually checked Jamie's phone, making sure he wasn't missing any important calls. Jamie didn't think much of it, but Adam's actions would soon prove crucial.

That evening, Jamie returned home, exhausted, and was greeted by his wife with a mysterious smile. "Close your eyes," she said, her eyes sparkling with excitement. Jamie obeyed, and as he opened them, he was met with an incredible sight: his wife stood beside a brand new Jeep Wrangler, adorned with a giant bow. Jamie's jaw dropped as he stared at the vehicle of his dreams.

Jamie was so excited that he couldn't wait to go for a ride with his wife. He hugged her tightly, tears of joy welling up in his eyes. "How did you do this?" he asked, still in disbelief. His wife smiled, "I've been planning this for months, and Adam helped me keep it a secret." Jamie grinned, feeling grateful for his wife's thoughtfulness and Adam's discretion. As they drove off into the sunset, Jamie knew that all his hard work had been worth it. He had finally achieved his dream, and he had his loving wife to thank for it.

outline: Lisa turned thirty-five last weekend.
Lisa's friends threw Lisa surprise birthday party.
The pals left, and Becky looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection.
The party became a little too loud and police were called.
Lisa will never forget this birthday party.
responses:
